article: When I was a little girl, every Sunday my family of six would put on their best clothes and go to Sunday School and then church. The kids in elementary school would all _ together to sing songs, and then later divide into groups _ on their ages.  One Easter Sunday, all the kids arrived with big eyes and big stories about what the Easter Bunny had brought. While all of of the kids shared their stories with _ , one young boy, whom I would call Bobby, sat _ . One of the teachers, _ this, said to him, "And what did the Easter Bunny bring you?" He replied, "My mom locked the door by accident so the Easter Bunny couldn't get _ ."  This sounded like a(n) _ reason to all of us kids, so we kept on going with the stories. My mom knew the true story, though. Bobby's mom was a _ parent, and she suspected that they just couldn't _ the Easter Bunny.  After Sunday School was over, everyone went off to _ . When my dad came to meet us, my mom _ that we were going home instead. At home, she explained that to make Bobby feel better, we were going to _ to be the Easter Bunny and make a basket of goodies for him and _ it at church. We all donated some of our candies to the basket, and headed back up to church. There, mom unzipped his coat, hung the basket over the hanger , and zipped up the coat and attached a _ .  Bobby, I'm sorry I missed your house last night. Happy Easter!        Love,      The Easter Bunny
